content:
• Tuesday, January 8, 2013
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) has resumed trading after disclosing Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) has made a...

    Clearwire (CLWR) has resumed trading after disclosing Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH) has made a complex $3.30/share offer for the company. Shares +9.3% AH to $3.19. The fact Sprint (NYSE:S) owns a majority of Clearwire shares and (given its rhetoric) might legally contest any agreement with Dish could be limiting Clearwire's gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:26 PM | 6 Comments
  • CBB

    Cincinnati Bell (CBB -6.9%) sold off after its CyrusOne (NASDAQ:CONE) subsidiary set a price...

    Cincinnati Bell (CBB -6.9%) sold off after its CyrusOne (NASDAQ:CONE) subsidiary set a price range of $16-$18 for its 16.5M-share IPO. That's good for a market cap of $312M-$351M. IPO buyers will own 84.5% of CyrusOne after the offering, and CBB just 9.7% (employees will own the rest). CyrusOne had revenue of $162.8M (+22% Y/Y) for the first 9 months of 2012, and a net loss of $5.1M. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • STX

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: STX +3%. GTXI +2%. JRCC +2%. GPN +2%. ODP +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: STX +3%. GTXI +2%. JRCC +2%. GPN +2%. ODP +2%.
    After-hours top losers: APOL -4%. S -3%. CREE -3%. CLDT -2%. PZE -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR) has received an unsolicited $3.30/share buyout offer from Dish Network...

    Clearwire (CLWR) has received an unsolicited $3.30/share buyout offer from Dish Network (NASDAQ:DISH). That easily trumps Sprint's (NYSE:S) $2.97/share offer. The proposal requires Clearwire sell Dish 24% of its spectrum for $2.2B and use the proceeds to pay down debt, as well as (with extra financing) agree to build a 4G network for Dish. Sprint has responded to the proposal by calling it "not viable ... in light of Clearwire's current legal and contractual obligations." Clearwire's board will "engage with Dish;" shares are halted. Sprint -2.5% AH. Dish -2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 7 Comments
  • REGI

    Renewable Energy (NASDAQ:REGI) +4.4% AH after disclosing the 2012 retroactive biodiesel tax...

    Renewable Energy (NASDAQ:REGI) +4.4% AH after disclosing the 2012 retroactive biodiesel tax credit, part of the deal signed last week to avert the fiscal cliff, should result in a net payment to the company equal to about one-third the number of 2012 gallons sold, increasing REGI's pre-tax operating earnings and EBITDA by a similar amount.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:28 PM
  • APOL

    More on Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL) FQ1 earnings: The knee-jerk AH pop dissipates as a closer...

    More on Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL) FQ1 earnings: The knee-jerk AH pop dissipates as a closer look shows enrollment declined 14.3% Y/Y. Also, the high end of FY2013 guidance is cut with revenues now expected at $3.65B-$3.75B and operating income of $500M-$550M. Shares -4.6% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD -3.6%) notes the USPTO has granted a request from rival WAN optimization hardware...

    Riverbed (RVBD -3.6%) notes the USPTO has granted a request from rival WAN optimization hardware vendor Silver Peak Systems, which Riverbed is suing for patent infringement, to reexamine two Riverbed patents. The company tries to calm investors by pointing out the USPTO grants 90% of reexamination requests, and that a September infringement trial remains on schedule. (USPTO patent filings: I, II) (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • ENLK

    Crosstex Energy (XTEX) -4.2% AH after announcing a public offering of 7.5M common units plus an...

    Crosstex Energy (XTEX) -4.2% AH after announcing a public offering of 7.5M common units plus an offering of 2.7M common units to certain funds affiliated with Magnetar Capital. Net proceeds will be used for capital expenditures on currently identified projects, including the Cajun-Sibon natural gas liquids pipeline expansion, and for general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM | 5 Comments
  • STX

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) +1.9% AH after stating it expects to report FQ2 (Dec. quarter) revenue of...

    Seagate (NASDAQ:STX) +1.9% AH after stating it expects to report FQ2 (Dec. quarter) revenue of at least $3.6B, above prior guidance of $3.5B and a consensus of $3.53B. Gross margin is expected to come in at 27%, down from FQ1's 28.4%. Seagate adds it bought back a whopping 30M shares in the quarter; it repurchased 20.5M shares in FQ1, and 139M in the whole of calendar 2012. WDC +2.4%. LSI-OLD +1.2%. MRVL +0.8%. Seagate's recent rally seems to be tempering the market's enthusiasm. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • APOL

    Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ1 EPS of $1.22 beats by $0.24. Revenue of $1.1B (-8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Apollo Group (NASDAQ:APOL): FQ1 EPS of $1.22 beats by $0.24. Revenue of $1.1B (-8% Y/Y) beats by $0.07B. Shares +4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • AA

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA): Q4 EPS of $0.06 in-line. Revenue of $5.9B beats by $0.29B. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)

    Alcoa (NYSE:AA): Q4 EPS of $0.06 in-line. Revenue of $5.9B beats by $0.29B. Shares +1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 7 Comments
  • NOV

    National Oilwell Varco (NOV -2.8%) is downgraded to Sector Perform with an $80 price target,...

    National Oilwell Varco (NOV -2.8%) is downgraded to Sector Perform with an $80 price target, lowered from $88, by RBC Capital, which says NOV's share price is heavily tied to rig equipment orders. The firm believes a near-to-intermediate term lull in orders may begin in 2013 as the industry digests the influx of equipment ordered in recent quarters.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • GDI

    Shares of Gardner Denver (GDI +0.7%) are active today, getting bid up on reports of renewed...

    Shares of Gardner Denver (GDI +0.7%) are active today, getting bid up on reports of renewed talks with buyout firms KKR (KKR +0.5%) and Advent International after talks with SPX Corp. (SPW -1%) ended. GDI has been actively seeking a buyer, and plans to begin meeting next week with Advent and KKR, as well as a team formed by Onex Corp. and TPG Capital.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • OXY

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY +2.3%) shares are strong after the company reports it is ahead of...

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY +2.3%) shares are strong after the company reports it is ahead of schedule in its cost-cutting efforts, which CEO Stephen Chazen says should be noticeable in OXY's Q4 results and become "very visible" in Q1 2013. OXY plans to achieve $300M in cash operating cost cuts this year and up to $450M in actual savings vs. 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 3 Comments
  • ARCI

    Appliance Recycling Centers of America (ARCI +5.5%) moves higher today after being picked by...

    Appliance Recycling Centers of America (ARCI +5.5%) moves higher today after being picked by Ameren Missouri to continue to provide appliance recycling services for it's ApplianceSavers Program through 2015. The program awards $50 to participating residential electric customers who turn in operating but energy inefficient refrigerators and freezers, manufactured in 2001 or earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM
  • MON

    Monsanto's (MON +2.6%) improved profit forecast for the year, by $100M to $7.65B, reflects a...

    Monsanto's (MON +2.6%) improved profit forecast for the year, by $100M to $7.65B, reflects a gain of $200M-$300M despite deciding to omit profit from Roundup Ready soybeans in Brazil because of the legal dispute over patent expiration, CFO Pierre Courduroux said on today's conference call. MON may be more aggressive in returning cash to shareholders, CEO Hugh Grant added.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • WPRT

    Coverage of Westport Innovations (WPRT -3.2%) is launched at Lake Street Capital with a Buy...

    Coverage of Westport Innovations (WPRT -3.2%) is launched at Lake Street Capital with a Buy rating and $54 price target, suggesting a near double from current levels. The firm says partnerships with engine OEMs such as Cummins, Volvo, Weichai and Caterpillar, its technology advantage with HPDI, and a new engine launching in 2013, position WPRT to benefit from the shift to natural gas from diesel fuel.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • LDK

    Solar stocks are rebounding from yesterday's drubbing after a Chinese government official states...

    Solar stocks are rebounding from yesterday's drubbing after a Chinese government official states the country wants to add 10GW of solar capacity this year, after growing its base by 4GW in 2012 to 7GW. However, skepticism exists about the government's ability to achieve this goal, given financing challenges. Last month, the government announced it wanted to encourage solar M&A activity and reduce its support for the industry. LDK +9%. YGE +6.5%. TSL +8.3%. SPWR +7.4%. JASO +6.9%. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • HLF

    Activist investor Robert Chapman promises "big news" regarding Herbalife (HLF +2.7%) sometime...

    Activist investor Robert Chapman promises "big news" regarding Herbalife (HLF +2.7%) sometime today or early tomorrow, tweets Charlie Gasparino of Fox Business News. Gasparino questions whether the news could be a lawsuit against Pershing Square's Bill Ackman. Chapman - who made news last week when he said Ackman will lose his fight against the company - has made HLF his largest long position.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 3 Comments
  • SCHN

    Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -7.2%) is shaping up as one of the day's biggest losers after reporting a...

    Schnitzer Steel (SCHN -7.2%) is shaping up as one of the day's biggest losers after reporting a FQ1 loss, weighed by worse-than-expected respective revenue drops of 32% and 27% in its metals recycling and auto parts businesses, as well as restructuring costs. The market was expecting at least a small profit.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • BA

    The problems continue to pile up for Boeing's (BA -3.2%) Dreamliner, as another 787 operated by...

    The problems continue to pile up for Boeing's (BA -3.2%) Dreamliner, as another 787 operated by Japan Airlines returns to Boston's Logan airport terminal prior to takeoff due to a fuel leak. The cause of the leak is not yet known, and the aircraft's 178 passengers, - who were bound for Tokyo - still remain on board.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 6 Comments
  • RIOT

    Venaxis (APPY -9.6%) slips today, despite its announcement late yesterday that European...

    Venaxis (APPY -9.6%) slips today, despite its announcement late yesterday that European regulators have approved the company's blood-based appendicitis test APPY1. Initial sales are slated to begin during Q1 in key territories, including the UK, Italy, France, Germany and Benelux countries. The company expects to announce agreements with top EU distributors beginning in the first quarter 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • VZ

    Verizon (VZ -3%), MetroPCS (PCS -2.8%), and Leap Wireless (LEAP -3.2%) are selling off after...

    Verizon (VZ -3%), MetroPCS (PCS -2.8%), and Leap Wireless (LEAP -3.2%) are selling off after AT&T announced it sold 10M+ smartphones in Q4. Verizon ticked higher yesterday after announcing it had 2.1M net wireless subscriber adds in Q4.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -7.1%) slumps after top customer Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) announces it sold...

    Universal Display (PANL -7.1%) slumps after top customer Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) announces it sold ~63M smartphones in Q4. With Strategy Analytics having estimated 56.9M smartphone sales for Q3, investors may have been hoping for a bigger number for the year's strongest quarter. The decline comes as Samsung, LG, Sony, and Panasonic show off (costly) OLED TVs at CES - a 55" LG model will be available for a mere $12K in March. Skyworks (SWKS -2.2%), another Samsung supplier, is also lower. Samsung fell 1.3% in Seoul.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • GEOY

    GeoEye (GEOY +4.4%) and merger partner DigitalGlobe (DGI +4.6%) trade higher after GeoEye...

    GeoEye (GEOY +4.4%) and merger partner DigitalGlobe (DGI +4.6%) trade higher after GeoEye announces it has received its first order from the Indian government for stereo imagery provided by the company's high-res GeoEye-1 satellite. The imagery will support India's freight railway system. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD +5.2%) ramps higher after reporting preliminary Q4 results, saying its EPS should...

    Cepheid (CPHD +5.2%) ramps higher after reporting preliminary Q4 results, saying its EPS should come in just above its prior guidance of $0.10 to $0.12 a share due to a favorable revenue mix. Analysts have been expecting a $0.02 per share net loss for the quarter. Revenue is expected to be below its prior view however, driven by weaker clinical revenue from high-burden developing countries

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • GBX

    Greenbrier Companies (GBX +6.4%) gains after reporting strong demand for railcars, posting over...

    Greenbrier Companies (GBX +6.4%) gains after reporting strong demand for railcars, posting over $430M in new business across multiple railcar types since the start of its current fiscal year, which began on September 1. The company has received orders for over 4,200 units, including orders for 1,250 of its higher margin tank cars with a value of approximately $160M, and additional orders in North America and Europe for 1,400 automotive-related products totaling $140M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • SYNC

    Jonathan Lebed favorite Synacor (SYNC -6.8%) is having a pretty bad day. The launch of Cisco's...

    Jonathan Lebed favorite Synacor (SYNC -6.8%) is having a pretty bad day. The launch of Cisco's Videoscape Unity platform, which delivers fresh competition for Synacor's TV Everywhere solutions by means of a more extensive software package, could be a factor.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • T

    AT&T (T -2.5%) remains negative after reporting it sold 10M+ smartphones in Q4. One concern:...

    AT&T (T -2.5%) remains negative after reporting it sold 10M+ smartphones in Q4. One concern: smartphone subsidies will depress AT&T's Q4 margin, and since much of Ma Bell's base already owns a smartphone, the service revenue benefit might not be huge. Apple (AAPL +0.1%) has given up its early gains. With research firms having reported the iPhone is doing very well in the U.S relative to Europe/China, sales concerns mostly revolve around international markets. Meanwhile, Tim Cook is paying another visit to China - is he there to nail down an elusive China Mobile deal?

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 9 Comments
  • NOK

    Telecom equipment stocks are having a rough day. The group has rallied in recent weeks, and (in...

    Telecom equipment stocks are having a rough day. The group has rallied in recent weeks, and (in spite of some encouraging signs) worries about wireline capex haven't fully dissipated. ALU -7.8%. ERIC -4.8%. JNPR -2.2%. CIEN -3.6%. INFN -2.3%. FFIV -1.8%. RVBD -3.3%. ALLT -5.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • SLRC

    Solar Capital (SLRC -3.3%) prices a 6M share secondary at $24.40/share for gross proceeds of...

    Solar Capital (SLRC -3.3%) prices a 6M share secondary at $24.40/share for gross proceeds of $146.4M. The company had about 39M shares floated as of Sept. 30. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • MDCO

    Medicines Co. (MDCO +10%) pushes through a 6-year high today as the stock surges after the drug...

    Medicines Co. (MDCO +10%) pushes through a 6-year high today as the stock surges after the drug maker announces positive Phase 3 trial results of its antiplatelet drug Cangrelor. Cangrelor demonstrated statistically significant improvement compared to clopidogrel, and MDCO intends to submit the results in the U.S. and E.U. for regulatory review in 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • THQIQ

    Bankrupt THQ (OTC:THQIQ -32.9%) has received court approval to complete the sale of its assets...

    Bankrupt THQ (OTC:THQIQ -32.9%) has received court approval to complete the sale of its assets through an auction on Jan. 22. P-E firm Clearlake Capital, which THQ agreed to sell its operating assets to for $60M, will make the opening bid. Speculators holding out hope for a higher offer seem to be selling on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 2 Comments
  • WWR

    Uranium Resources (URRE +4.5%) extends its South Texas exploration agreement with Cameco (CCJ...

    Uranium Resources (URRE +4.5%) extends its South Texas exploration agreement with Cameco (CCJ -1.8%) to a five-phase, five-year program to include the Tecolote tract. CCJ commits $4.3M to increase its interest to 70% in the expanded program, and will fund and be the exploration operator for Phase III.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 3 Comments
  • DELL

    More on William Blair's downgrade of EMC (EMC -2.2%): Analyst Jason Ader says checks indicate...

    More on William Blair's downgrade of EMC (EMC -2.2%): Analyst Jason Ader says checks indicate EMC had trouble closing deals with large companies in Q4, something that will likely lead results to be in-line or below consensus. He's also worried about the threat posed by newer, more efficient technologies - many Internet/cloud companies have been eschewing traditional storage gear in favor of flash storage and commodity hardware. Oppenheimer and Craig-Hallum expressed concerns about EMC last week. NTAP -3.9%. BRCD -2%. ELX -1.8%. QLGC -1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • BA

    Shares of Boeing (BA -1.2%) slip today on the back of yesterday's Dreamliner fire at Boston's...

    Shares of Boeing (BA -1.2%) slip today on the back of yesterday's Dreamliner fire at Boston's Logan Airport. The fire is just another body-blow to the Dreamliner program on the back of last months groundings. BB&T cuts the shares to hold on yesterday's incident, saying that although electrical problems with new aircraft are common, fires are not. Key aspects of the aircraft's electrical architecture appear to be faulty, and the firm thinks it's time to step to the sidelines until the problem gets resolved.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • PSX

    Phillips 66 (PSX -0.1%) and Global Partners (GLP +6%) strike a five-year deal to use the rail...

    Phillips 66 (PSX -0.1%) and Global Partners (GLP +6%) strike a five-year deal to use the rail network of Canadian Pacific Railway (NYSE:CP) to transport oil from the Bakken shale field in North Dakota to PSX's Bayway refinery in New Jersey. GLP will use its rail transloading, logistics and transportation system to transport ~91M barrels, or 50K bbl/day, of crude oil during the period.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -3.3%) says it found good quality oil in the sub-salt South Tupi prospect in the...

    Petrobras (PBR -3.3%) says it found good quality oil in the sub-salt South Tupi prospect in the Santos Basin offshore Brazil, and preliminary evaluations indicate it may be linked to the giant Lula Field that is part of one of the world's largest oil finds in 30 years. PBR says it will continue exploration until it can declare the area commercially viable in Sept. 2014.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM | 2 Comments
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) rockets 24%, although it's hard to work out why. The stock's...

    Cell Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CTIC) rockets 24%, although it's hard to work out why. The stock's been fairly volatile over the past few months, and often seems to receive a big lift on news of Pixuvri, its treatment of aggressive non-Hodgkin B-cell lymphomas.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 3 Comments
  • SSRI

    Silver Standard Resources (SSRI +2%) says it produced 8.6M oz. of silver in 2012, exceeding the...

    Silver Standard Resources (SSRI +2%) says it produced 8.6M oz. of silver in 2012, exceeding the high end of its guidance range, and produced 11.2M lbs. of zinc, near the high end of guidance. For FY13, SSRI expects to produce and sell 8.2M-8.5M oz. of silver and produce more than 20M lbs. of zinc.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM
  • FIO

    Fusion-io (FIO -7.5%) falls hard on a downgrade to Market Perform from William Blair's Jason...

    Fusion-io (FIO -7.5%) falls hard on a downgrade to Market Perform from William Blair's Jason Ader. His checks indicate soft enterprise bookings, and that Intel's Ramsdale 910 server flash cards are gaining momentum. Ader notes the 910 is much cheaper than FIO's solutions, and that some believe it offers better write performance (ed: FIO's cards are known in part for their read performance). He adds the enterprise flash card market, demand for FIO's ioTurbine software, and partnerships with Cisco and NetApp are all developing slower than expected. EMC (EMC -1.1%) has also been downgraded.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • FOSL

    A number of luxury stocks trade higher after a solid holiday sales report from Signet sets the...

    A number of luxury stocks trade higher after a solid holiday sales report from Signet sets the table. Recent economic news on Chinese luxury spending has also helped tipped sentiment in the sector. Advancers: FOSL +2.9%, COH +2.3%, KORS +1.1%, RL +1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • REGN

    Regeneron (NASDAQ:REGN) -4.1%, although it's not obvious why. Q4 sales of Eylea, its eye...

    Regeneron (NASDAQ:REGN) -4.1%, although it's not obvious why. Q4 sales of Eylea, its eye treatment for wet age-related macular degeneration, were $276M. That's above estimates of $264.2M and brings the total for 2012 to $838M. Regeneron forecasts that U.S. sales will grow 50%, leading to annual revenue of $1.26B and already beating a Citigroup prediction that Eylea would generate peak annual sales of $1.1B in 2021. (Presentation for JPM conference)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes (BHI -1.9%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Sterne Agee, on concerns about...

    Baker Hughes (BHI -1.9%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy at Sterne Agee, on concerns about profitability in Latin America, uncertain profit margins in the U.S. and Canada, a cloudy outlook in the Eastern Hemisphere, and better risk-reward among rival companies. Also, RBC cuts shares to Sector Perform, forecasting BHI's top line up ~7% in 2013 vs. peer average estimates of 12% growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • UCTT

    Ultra Clean (UCTT -5.1%) opens lower after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $88.5M-$90M, below...

    Ultra Clean (UCTT -5.1%) opens lower after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $88.5M-$90M, below prior guidance of $94M-$99M and a consensus of $95.7M. No explanation is given for the warning, but it comes at a time when the near-term outlook for chip equipment makers has become increasingly bleak.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures are flat-to-lower in thin trading as investors sit tight ahead of...

    Market preview: Stock futures are flat-to-lower in thin trading as investors sit tight ahead of the start of Q4 earnings season, which Alcoa is set to kick off after the bell. The S&P benchmark is -0.1%. Sears is +2.3% after appointing Eddie Lampert as CEO and providing upbeat guidance, while Monsanto is +3.2% following its FQ1 report, although Yum Brands (-5%) is not so yummy due to problems with Chinese chicken. Later: Consumer Credit
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • PERI

    Premarket gainers: PERI +19%. STSI +16%. CTIC +8%. PPHM +5%. Losers: GME -10%. APPY -6%. CY -6%....

    Premarket gainers: PERI +19%. STSI +16%. CTIC +8%. PPHM +5%.
    Losers: GME -10%. APPY -6%. CY -6%. CLMT -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • CLMT

    Calumet Specialty Products Partners (NASDAQ:CLMT) -5.4% premarket after announcing an offering...

    Calumet Specialty Products Partners (NASDAQ:CLMT) -5.4% premarket after announcing an offering of 5M common units at $31.81 each, as it seeks to raise funds to repay debt and for general purposes. The maker of oil and fuel products recently had 57.6M shares outstanding.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:07 AM
  • EA

    The bad news from GameStop on its holiday sales has game sellers on watch for volatility....

    The bad news from GameStop on its holiday sales has game sellers on watch for volatility. Premarket: EA -1.0%, ATVI -0.6%, TTWO -0.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • HPR

    Bill Barrett (BBG) appoints COO R. Scot Woodall as interim CEO following Fred Barrett's decision...

    Bill Barrett (BBG) appoints COO R. Scot Woodall as interim CEO following Fred Barrett's decision to step down as chairman, CEO, President and a director, effective immediately. Barrett stepped down after 11 years at the helm to spend time with family and on other activities, BBG says. Shares -1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • GME

    GameStop (NYSE:GME) says holiday sales fell 4.6% at comparable stores with U.S. stores declining...

    GameStop (NYSE:GME) says holiday sales fell 4.6% at comparable stores with U.S. stores declining 3.5% and global stores falling off 6.4%. The company says strong digital growth and the launch of the Wii U was more than offset by sluggish traffic at stores - prompting it to set the expectation for Q4 profit at the low end of its current guidance range. GME -7.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • AXAS

    Abraxas Petroleum (NASDAQ:AXAS) +2.7% premarket after issuing upbeat results in an operational...

    Abraxas Petroleum (NASDAQ:AXAS) +2.7% premarket after issuing upbeat results in an operational update. In the Eagle Ford shale, the Cobra B 1H averaged 592 boe/day (95% oil) on a restricted choke over its first 30 days of production, and the Mustang 1H is currently flowing to sales at rates above the company's in-house type curve.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM
  • AYI

    Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI): FQ1 EPS of $0.69 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $481.1M (+1.4% Y/Y)...

    Acuity Brands (NYSE:AYI): FQ1 EPS of $0.69 misses by $0.11. Revenue of $481.1M (+1.4% Y/Y) misses by $17.69M. Shares -3.1% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM
  • SIG

    Shares of Signet (NYSE:SIG) move 2.4% higher premarket after the company reports...

    Shares of Signet (NYSE:SIG) move 2.4% higher premarket after the company reports better-than-expected holiday sales and boosts its estimates for Q4 profit. On watch: ZLC, NILE.
